get.summary: Get associated properties for a policy
get.description: Run this operation to return the complete list of property associations for a specific policy with a given `policyId`.

200.description: Returns information about the associated properties.

schema.description: Contains detailed information about all active properties that are assigned to the policy.

content.description: Lists the results of the request.

items.description: Object representing details of property assigned to the policy.
items.title: policy-property-info.json

version.description: The version number of the property.

groupId.description: Identifies the group which the property belongs to.

network.description: The networks where you can activate or deactivate the policy version, either `PRODUCTION` or `STAGING`.

links.description: Hypermedia links to help navigate through the result set.

items.description: Hypermedia links to help navigate through the result set, or to identify the current item whose `rel` is `self`.

href.description: A relative path to the currently requested object or a specific page of the result set.

rel.description: The relationship between the current and linked result sets. A value of `self` links to the current result set, while `first`, `next`, and `last` link to different sets of paginated data.

number.description: Specifies the number of the returned page.

size.description: Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects.

totalElements.description: Specifies the total number of the available objects.

totalPages.description: Specifies the total number of the available pages.

parameters.name: propertyId
parameters.description:
"The ID of the property linked with the `policyId`. For the `propertyId` value, use the `id` value from the [Get associated
properties for a policy](ref:get-policy-properties) response. \n"

delete.summary: Remove a property from a policy
delete.description: Run this operation to remove the link between the specified `policyId` and `propertyId`. If the `staging` or `prod` is not specified in the network query parameter, then the link is removed in both the networks if present. It does not delete the property or the policy.

204.description: The property is no longer associated with the policy.

get.description: Run this operation to return the complete list of the associated properties.

200.description: Returns information about the associated properties.

schema.description: Contains information about the newest property version and the property’s current configuration on the production and staging networks.

name.description: The name of the property. This value also appears at the start of each separate property object.

groupId.description: The group association for the property.

newestVersion.description: Contains information about the newest property version.

items.description: Contains information about the newest property version and the property’s current configuration on the production and staging networks for a specific `policyId`.

version.description: The version number of the property.

activatedBy.description: The name of the user who activated property.

activationDate.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format indicating when the property was activated.

cloudletsOrigins.description: Contains information about each conditional origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `CUSTOMER`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `NETSTORAGE`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

referencedPolicies.description: The names of Cloudlets policies for this version of the property.

production.description: Contains information about the property’s current configuration on the `production` network.

items.description: Contains information about the newest property version and the property’s current configuration on the production and staging networks for a specific `policyId`.

version.description: The version number of the property.

activatedBy.description: The name of the user who activated property.

activationDate.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format indicating when the property was activated.
